zone.line: There now the Sun gold
The Sun had had sunk, but lines of light
on the
Yet hung upon ask ashen clouds, and on the points
-ints
Of the fair level grass, and nodding flowers
-wers
old
And the grey dandelions hoary hair
And minglinged with the shades of twilight lay
and
On the brown mossy woods: but in the East
lingeringly
The broad & pallid moon hovering arose
Between the black trunks of the crowded trees
And one two faint stars were gathering overhead
-head
Rosalind
Is it not strange Louisa, said the youth
I never saw the sun — We will walk here
Tomorrow — thou shalt look on it with me.
youth & lady
That night these this happiest lays mingled
lay
In love & sleep. — but when the morning came
The Lady found her lover dead & cold.—
Let none believe that God in mercy gave
stroke wild
That death — the Lady died not, nor grew
But years & years lived on;— in truth, I think

line.del: If to be mad is to be unlike mankind
